Class Turtle

java.lang.Object
  Turtle

public class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object

Turtle for drawing pictures on a World object.

Version:
2017-01-05.
Author:
Kurt Jensen.

public void jump(double x,
                 double y)
Jumps as specified without drawing and without turning. Ends with a penDow.

Parameters:
x - Distance forward.
y - Distance sideways (+ is right and - is left).

                   double y)
Jumps to specified coordinates without drawing and without turning. Ends with a penDown.

Parameters:
x - x coordinate.
y - y coordinate.

spiral

public void spiral(int n,
                   double delta)
Draws a spiral.

Parameters:
n - Number of sides.
delta - Difference in length between two succeeding sides (equal to shortest side).

square

public void square(double size)
Draws a square.

Parameters:
size - Length of each side.

squarePatternDiagonal

public void squarePatternDiagonal(int n,
                                  double size)
Draws a pattern of squares where most are placed in the diagonal.

Parameters:
n - Depth of pattern (for n=1 a sigle square is drawn).
size - Size of largest square.

squarePatternFour

public void squarePatternFour(int n,
                              int size)
Draws a pattern of squares, where each square immediately surrounds four other squares. For each level of depth the size of the squares is divided by 3.

Parameters:
n - Depth of pattern (for n=1 a sigle square is drawn).
size - Size of largest square.

squares

public void squares(int n,
                    double size,
                    double gap)
Draws a number of squares "behind" each other.

Parameters:
n - Number of squares.
size - Size of squares.
gap - Horizontal and vertical gap between adjacent squares.

squares2

public void squares2(int n,
                     double gap)
Draws a number of squares inside each other.

Parameters:
n - Number of squares.
gap - Gap between adjacent squares. (equal to size of smallest square).

squaresCentered

public void squaresCentered(int n,
                            double gap)
Draws a number of squares inside each other.

Parameters:
n - Number of squares.
gap - Gap between adjacent squares (equal to size of smallest square).

squaresCornered

public void squaresCornered(int n,
                            double size)
Draws a number of squares inside each other so that all upper left corners are in the same point.

Parameters:
n - Number of squares.
size - Size of largest square.

squaresHorizontal

public void squaresHorizontal(int n,
                              double size,
                              double gap)
Draws a number of squares on a "horizontal" line.

Parameters:
n - Number of squares.
size - Size of squares.
gap - Distance between adjacent squares.

star

public void star(double size)
Draws a star with five corners.

Parameters:
size - Length of each side.

testAll

public static void testAll()
This STATIC method allows the instructors (and the students) to see whether all the implemented methods in Turtle 1 and Turtle 2 work as expected.

addToCanvas

public void addToCanvas()
Adds this Actor to the Canvas.

getAngle

public double getAngle()
Returns the angle that this Actor is facing (in degrees). Will always be in the interval [0, 360).

Returns:
The angle in degrees of this Actor.

getCanvas

public Canvas getCanvas()
Returns the Canvas.

Returns:
A Canvas object representing the canvas in which this Actor resides.

getColor

public int getColor()
Returns the current color of this Actor (as an integer to be used in setColor()).

Returns:
An integer representing the current color of this Actor.

getColorInstance

public java.awt.Color getColorInstance()
Returns the current Color object of this Actor.

Returns:
A Color object representing the color that this Actor draws with.

getX

public double getX()
Returns the x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor. Will not necessarily be an integer-value.

Returns:
The x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.

getY

public double getY()
Returns the y-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor. Will not necessarily be an integer-value.

Returns:
The x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.

isPenDown

public boolean isPenDown()
Checks whether or not this Actor is currently drawing.

Returns:
A boolean representing whether or not this Actor is currently drawing.

move

public void move(double distance)
Moves this Actor a specified number of units in the direction it is facing. Will draw if distance > 0.

Parameters:
distance - The distance for this Actor to travel (in pixels).

moveTo

public void moveTo(double newX,
                   double newY)
Moves this Actor to a specified position. Will draw if penDown.

Parameters:
newX - The new x-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.
newY - The new y-coordinate (in pixels) of this Actor.

penDown

public void penDown()
Instructs this Actor to start drawing.

penUp

public void penUp()
Instructs this Actor to stop drawing.

setColor

public void setColor(int i)
Sets the color to c, 0 <= c < 6 0: black, 1: red, 2: blue, 3: yellow, 4: green, 5: magenta Will set the color to Black if an integer outside the interval [0, 5] is chosen.

Parameters:
i - The new color of this Actor.

setColor

public void setColor(java.lang.String col)
Sets the color to the specified color. Allowed values are: - "black" - "red" - "blue" - "yellow" - "green" - "magenta" - any hex color, that is "#RRGGBB" Will change the color to Black if an invalid String is chosen.

Parameters:
col - A String representing the new color of this Actor.

turn

public void turn(double degrees)
Instructs this Actor to rotate a specified number of degrees (clockwise).

Parameters:
degrees - The number of degrees this Actor rotates.

turnTo

public void turnTo(double degrees)
Sets the rotation of this Actor to a specified number of degrees.

Parameters:
degrees - The new rotation (in degrees) of this Actor.
